synopsis.text: Sumireko Ogawa dreamed of becoming a famous author ever since winning a literature prize in secondary school. Now in her late twenties, her writing career has stalled, and she works as a bookstore clerk. When Sumireko receives a mysterious book that transforms her into a child after reading its poems, she sees a second chance to achieve literary success. Sumireko's eccentric younger coworker, Ren Adashino, discovers her transformation and reveals he has knowledge of the city's recent supernatural incidents. As Sumireko investigates these strange happenings with Ren, the events fuel her creativity. However, the mysteries prove increasingly dangerous. Through her experiences, Sumireko finds the inspiration needed to restart her writing career. But will she ultimately succeed as an author, or will the supernatural threats overwhelm her? This modern tale combines elements of the weird and wondrous with themes of friendship, creativity, and personal growth.
